text: A vertical stick 20 m long casts a shadow 10 m long on the ground. At the same time, a tower casts the shadow 50 m long on the ground. Find the height of the tower.
In the figure, ∆ABC is similar to ∆EDC. If we have AB = 4 cm, ED = 3 cm, CE = 4.2 and CD = 4.8 cm, find the value of CA and CB.
The area of similar triangles, ABC and DEF are 144 cm² and 81 cm² respectively. If the longest side of larger ABC be 36 cm, then the longest side of smaller DEF is
Two isosceles triangles have equal angles and their areas are in the ratio 16 : 25. Find the ratio of their corresponding heights.
The areas of two similar triangles are respectively 9 cm² and 16 cm². Find the ratio of their corresponding sides.
Two poles of height 6 m and 11 m stand vertically upright on a plane ground. If the distance between their foot is 2 m, find the distance between their tops.
The radius of a circle is 9 cm and length of one of its chords is 14 cm. Find the distance of the chord from the centre.
Find the length of a chord that is at a distance of 12 cm from the centre of a circle of radius 13 cm.
If O is the centre of circle, find x. [Figure shows a circle with center O, and points on the circumference forming an angle x and a central angle 70 degrees]
Find the value of x in the given figure. [Figure shows a cyclic quadrilateral with one exterior angle x and one opposite interior angle 130 degrees]

Find the value of x in the figure, if it is given that AC and BD are diameters of the circle. [Figure shows two intersecting diameters AC and BD, with a chord AB forming angle x with diameter AC, and an angle 60 degrees formed by chord CD at the center O]
Find the value of x in the given figure. [Figure shows a circle with two secants intersecting outside, with given segment lengths 4, 3, 5, and x]
Find the value of x in the given figure. [Figure shows a circle with two intersecting chords, with segment lengths 4, 9, x, and 3]
Find the value of x in the given figure. [Figure shows a circle with a tangent and a secant from an external point, with segment lengths 5, 4, and x]
ABC is a right angled triangle with BC = 6 cm and AB = 8 cm. A circle with centre O and radius x has been inscribed in ABC. What is the value of x?

In the given figure, two straight lines PQ and RS intersect each other at O. If ∠SOT = 75°, find the value of a, b and c. [Figure shows intersecting lines PQ and RS, with a line segment OT. Angles are marked: ∠ROQ = a, ∠POT = b, ∠TOS = 75°, ∠SOQ = c, and a = 4c, b = 2c]
In the following figure A, B, C and D are the concyclic points. Find the value of x. [Figure shows a cyclic quadrilateral ABCD with angle A = x, and angle C = 130 degrees]

In the following figure, it is given that O is the centre of the circle and ∠AOC = 140°. Find ∠ABC. [Figure shows a circle with center O. Angle AOC is 140 degrees (reflex), and inscribed angle ABC is x]

In a right angle triangle BAC given below, AD is the altitude of the hypotenuse BC. The figure is followed by three possible inferences: 1. Triangle ABD and triangle CAD are similar. 2. Triangle ADB and triangle CDA are congruent. 3. Triangle ADB and triangle CAB are similar. Mark the correct option.

A point on the circle is connected to another point at a distance 'b' from O on the extension of a radius, forming a side 'c']

A 25 feet long ladder is placed against the wall with its base 7 feet from the wall. The base of the ladder is drawn out so that the top comes down by half the distance that the base is drawn out. This distance is in the range:

In KyaKya Island, there is a circular park. There are four points of entry into the park, namely – P, Q, R and S. The king of the island constructed three paths PQ, RS, and PS. The length of the path PQ is 10 units, and the length of the path RS is 7 units. The paths PQ and RS are extended past Q and R respectively, and they meet at a point T. The path from Q to T measures 8 units, and it was found that the $\angle$PTS is 60°. Find the area (in square units) enclosed by the paths PT, TS, and PS.

There are two circles $C_1$, and $C_2$ of radii 3 and 8 units respectively. The common internal tangent T, touches the circles at points P and Q respectively. The line joining the centers of the circles intersects T at X. The distance of X from the center of the smaller circle is 5 units. What is the length of the line segment PQ?

In an equilateral triangle ABC, whose length of each side is 3 cm, D is a point on BC such that BD = $\frac{1}{3}$ of BC. What is the length of AD?

A pole has to be erected on the boundary of a circular park of diameter 13 meters in such a way that the difference of its distances from two diametrically opposite fixed gates A and B on the boundary is 7 meters. The shortest distance of the pole from one of the gates is ___
